Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Checkpoint on H3
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=494554680

Elverton,

Yes checkpoints should be fast. It's just a matter of creating a directory, making hard links, and rolling logs. No large data file is written to disk, which might be what you would expect to take time.

Travis

On Tue, 15 Jan 2013 11:28:57 -0000
"Elverton" <uelverton@...> wrote:

> Hello everybody,
> 
> I made a checkpoint on a 790 million URI crawled
> and it took only 2 seconds and generates only a file
> named "cp00001-20130114200727". Is this right?
> 
> Att,
> Elverton.
>
